channel.title: tir
channel.description: "Today I Read:" a collection of the little things you read each day. Cherish them!

item.title: Future Cyberwar
item.description: A hypothetical unconventional attack, via the credit scores and preputations of members of the military.

item.title: George Soros on George Soros
item.description: A response to the noteworthy n+1 review of Soros's philosophy.

item.title: The New Reading Environment
item.description: Online reader interaction, reaction, and regurgitating dramatically change writing in the first place.

item.title: I have impeached myself
item.description: Richard Nixon's retrospective on his presidency, and especially its end.

item.title: Orthodoxxed!
item.description: Criticism of Sokal-style academic hoaxes. I don't agree with it entirely, but it points out correctly that the role of acadmic publications is more complicated than determining value.

item.title: Decision Engines
item.description: Probably the form of the first self-driving car movie.

item.title: Private BitTorrent trackers are markets
item.description: Light summary of a late paper. Incentives can be adjusted to increase availability of old files.

item.title: Violence and the Sacred: College as an incubator of Girardian terror
item.description: Observes violence for differentiation. I disagree entirely with the subtext about the value of college, but the analysis was enjoyable.

item.title: Remember Me on This Computer
item.description: Angsty: argues the internet is gutting film criticism. Good enough that I bought Hamrah's book.

item.title: Eigengrau
item.description: Eigengrau is black with retinal background noise.
